intro: Helipterum zacchaeus, commonly known as the golden everlasting, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces vibrant yellow flowers that are often used in floral arrangements due to their long-lasting nature. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun exposure. Helipterum zacchaeus is also valued for its ornamental appeal and resilience in arid environments.
